course_main_structural_unit.address:
Nooruse 1
50411 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The objective of the course is to give an introductory overview of the main topics of Digital Signal Processing. Lectures cover mainly sampling, transforms and digital filters. In laboratory experiments students have the opportunity to observe, explore and manipulate characteristics and behaviors of actual devices, systems, and processes.
description.et: Aine annab ülevaate tänapäeval praktikas laialdaselt kasutusel olevatest andmeedastusliidestest ning digitaalse signaalitöötluse põhitõdedest. Loengutes käsitletakse põhiliselt signaalide diskreetimist, digitaalseid filtreid ja asjakohaseid teisendusi. Praktikumides on tudengitel võimalus õpitut rakendada reaalsete süsteemide peal, muuta neid huvitavaid parameetreid ning jälgida süsteemide käitumist erinevates olukordades.

objectives.en: The objective of this course is to give an introductory review of the main topics of Digital Signal Processing with the laboratory experience as essential part of the course.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade digitaalse signaalitöötluse põhitõdedest ja -printsiipidest reaalsete süsteemidega töötamisest tuleneva praktilise kogemuse kaudu.

learning_outcomes.en: After successful completion of the course, student ...
1. is able to utilise A/D converter
2. knows how to sample a continuous signal and describes possible distortions and noise
learning_outcomes.et: 2. Oskab pidavat signaali diskreetida ja kvantida ning hinnata tekkivaid mürasi ja moonutusi.

learning_outcomes.en: 3. calculates convolution of two discrete signals
learning_outcomes.et: 3. Oskab arvutada kahe diskreetse  funktsiooni sidumit.

learning_outcomes.en: 4. explains the principles of DFT and carries out relevant calculations
learning_outcomes.et: 4. Mõistab diskreetse Fourier' pöörde (DFT) sisu ja teab kuidas seda arvutada.
5. Teab, kuidas leida FIR-filtri vastavaid kordajaid h(k).

learning_outcomes.en: 6. designs suitable FIR filter for specific task
learning_outcomes.et: 6. Suudab disainida sobiva FIR-filtri mingi konkreetse probleemi lahendamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: 7. understands the concept of IIR filter

independent_work.et:
1 Basic CT and DT signals and systems, system properties
2 Elementary complex signals. Unit impulse and unit step functions
3 Periodic signals, fundamental properties of systems. The convolution sum and integral
4 Properties of LTI systems
5 Difference and differential equations. Singularity functions
6 Fourier series analysis of CT and DT signals. Properties of CT and DT Fourier series
7 Fourier series and LTI systems, filtering
8 CT Fourier transform. Representation of aperiodic and periodic signals
9 Properties of the CT Fourier transform
10 Basic Fourier transform pairs
11 DT Fourier transform
12 Representation of aperiodic and periodic signals
13 Properties of the DT Fourier transform
14 Laplacian transform
15 Properties of Laplacian transform
16 FIR and IIR filters
17 Applications of digital filters

debt_elimination.et: A resit exam is possible within 3 days after the last examination.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. Li Tan, "Digital Signal Processing : Fundamentals and Applications", Amsterdam [etc.] : Elsevier/Academic Press, 2008.
2. Richard G. Lyons, "Understanding Digital Signal Processing", 2001.
3. S. Haykin and B. Van Veen, Signals and Systems, 2nd edition, John Wiley & sons, Inc 2003.
4. Alan V. Oppenheim, "Signals & systems ", Upper Saddle River (N.J.) : Prentice-Hall International, 1997.
